QA - Gib Weatherline

Framing set out adequate to support all sheet edges. Stud and nog spacing complies with GIB Weatherline® technical literature i.e. studs must be at a maximum of 400mm or GIB Weatherline® technical literature i.e. studs must be at a maximum of 400mm or
Framing straightness. Nogs flush with studs, studs flush with top/bottom plates and no protruding fixings.
Prior to installation GIB Weatherline® sheets to be kept dry
Correct fixings used and installed at correct centres according to GIB Weatherline® technical literature
Sheets overhang the bottom plate on a concrete slab by a minimum of 15mm as per GIB Weatherline® technical literature.
GIB Weatherline® Tape installed to vertical/ horizontal sheet joints, corners, and openings in accordance with GIB Weatherline® technical literature.
Building service penetrations through GIB Weatherline® sheets sealed using Proclima Kaflex or Roflex penetration seal grommets. Proclima installation instructions to be followed.
GIB Weatherline® flashing and sill tapes to be applied on doors and windows as per GIB Weatherline® technical literature.
GIB Weatherline® report sent to client

QA - Wall Underlay
Ensure substrate is even and free from any protrusions, nails, screws, loose pieces, dust, dirt, etc
Line the internal or external corners of the wall underlay with a vertical 400mm wide strip of ADHERO in place with equal length on each of the walls. with min 150mm overlap on either side
Apply all the remaining membranes - one by one - horizontally in an overlapping, waterproof manner. The minimum horizontal and vertical overlap for membranes is 150 mm
Work all air bubbles in ADHERO to sheet edge, and flatten all creases
Cut ADHERO at 45° from the corners and Fold ADHERO into all sides of the rough door and window opening to the back edge of framing and adhere to all sides.
Apply TESCON EXTOSEAL sill tape to the opening as per application guide
Use ROFLEX grommets and TESCON EXTORA 60 tape to seal all pipe penetrations made through the ADHERO. Refer to the ROFLEX installation guide
Use KAFLEX grommets and TESCON EXTORA 60 tape to seal all round cable penetrations made through the ADHERO. Refer to the KAFLEX installation guide
Wall underlay report sent through to client
QA - Pro Clima - Wall Underlay
Check substrate to ensure it is even and free from any protrusions, nails, screws etc.
Check substrate is dry and free of contaminants before applying ADHERO
Line the internal and external corners of the substrate with at least 400 mm in width and adhere it vertically in place with equal length on each of the walls.
Minimum of 150mm overlap is required at joints
Work all air bubbles in ADHERO to sheet edge and flatten all creases.
Apply sealing tape, sill tape, sealing grommet for joints, door and window opening, services penetrations as per manufacturer’s specifications (or as per designer’s project specific details)
Repair all cuts and tears in ADHERO with TESCON EXTORA 100 sealing tape, to a minimum 50mm past the edges of the damaged area.
Send report to client
